name: Drawer
description: A panel that slides in from the edge of the screen, overlaying content. Used for secondary tasks, navigation, or detail panels without leaving the current page.

do: Use for secondary tasks like editing details or filters
Provide a clear close mechanism (button or outside click)
Use consistent placement (left for nav, right for details)
Include a header with context about the drawer content
dont: Don't use for critical flows that require full attention â€” use a page instead
Don't put complex multi-step forms in drawers

variants.name: Left Side
variants.description: Slides in from the left edge

variants.name: Right Side
variants.description: Slides in from the right edge

props.name: onClose
props.description: Callback when the drawer should close

props.name: side
props.description: Which edge the drawer slides from

props.name: showClose
props.description: Show the close button in the header

props.name: scaleBackground
props.description: Scale the background when drawer opens

accessibility.guideline: Trap focus within the drawer when open
Escape key should close the drawer
Return focus to trigger element when closed
Announce drawer opening to screen readers
